intro: Tagetes wislizeni, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tagetes wislizeni is also known for its strong scent and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
